p: The NSs-ΔNΔC monomer, molecular mass 19,029 Da, measures approximately 30 × 30 × 50 Å. It is composed of eight α-helices with helices α1-α6 and α8 arranged around a long central helix α7. Two short 3 10 helices are also present ( Figure 2). Residues 234–244 are devoid of secondary structure and traverse approximately 30 Å of the NSs surface, packed against helices α3 and α7. Two NSs-ΔNΔC monomers constitute the asymmetric unit, with an interface formed by their α8 helices ( Figure 2—figure supplement 1). There was no visible electron density for the first N-terminal and the five C-terminal amino acids; these residues are unaccounted for in the crystal structure.
